thread.title: Man United news: Michael Carrick a doubt for EFL Cup final after limping out of St Etienne win | Metro News
thread.title_full: Man United news: Michael Carrick a doubt for EFL Cup final after limping out of St Etienne win | Metro News

author: Sean Kearns For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Man United news: Michael Carrick a doubt for EFL Cup final after limping out of St Etienne win | Metro News
text:
Search Metro Follow us Michael Carrick a doubt for EFL Cup final after being forced off with calf injury during St Etienne win Sean Kearns for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 6:50 pm Michael Carrick was forced off through injury (Picture: BPI) 
Manchester United are sweating on Michael Carrick’s fitness ahead of Sunday’s EFL Cup final against Southampton after the midfielder limped out of the side’s clash with St Etienne. 
Jose Mourinho’s side had a three-goal lead going into the game in France but the 54-year-old started with a strong starting XI against the Ligue 1 side. Keep smiling! Mourinho of all people melts hearts with touching message to Ranieri 
Henrikh Mkhitaryan scored United’s only goal before limping out with a hamstring injury and Carrick followed the Armenian in leaving the field through injury. 
The veteran left the field pointing at the back of his leg and went straight down the tunnel to receive treatment for a suspected calf injury. Mkhitaryan was also forced off (Picture: Getty) 
The Red Devils take on Southampton at Wembley on Sunday but Mourinho could be forced into changes after a costly night in France.
